concept.title: Credentials
concept.shortdesc: If the remote server requires authentication, configure the authentication method that the origin must use to log in to the remote server.

conbody.p:
SFTP/FTP Client origincredentialscredentialsSFTP/FTP ClientSFTP/FTP Client originauthenticationConfigure one of the following authentication methods:
None The SFTP or FTP server does not require authentication.
Password The SFTP or FTP server requires authentication using a user name and password.
Private key The SFTP server requires authentication using a private key file. Store the private key file in a local directory. For the SFTP protocol only.

If using the SFTP protocol, you can also configure the origin to use strict host checking. When enabled, the origin connects to the SFTP server only if the server is listed in the known hosts file stored in a local directory. The known hosts file contains the host keys for the approved SFTP servers.
